list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Alexander Graham Bell was the inventor of the telephone.

list_ex_of_english: The uses of innovations are also often more diverse, or even divergent, compared to the idea of the inventor.
Fantasies about the harmonica inspired inventors to attempt, in very real ways, to create new and better instruments.
In response, one might invoke a natural right of any inventor to control the use of his invention.
This, in turn, serves only to intensify the predisposition of the inventor to direct his attention to these areas of research and application.
The self-professed inventor of the neighbourhood unit remains an important, though shadowy and under-documented figure.
A great deal of normal human education consists of learning an inventor y of indices, both natural and man-made; we learn what goes with what.
Like professional inventors, he was extremely conscious of priority.
There is also the distinct possibility that he positively enjoyed inventing things, as did so many of the professional inventors who were his contemporaries.
